title: 30's or before fonts take#2
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140307112552im_/http:/typophile.com/files/delete_4204.jpg)
  
Any ideas on this as well? found on paper dated 39.
author: Tyskern

comments.content:
German name, perhaps a German font from the era.  
Basalt, designed by W. Ege for Gensch & Hayse 1927. It was redesigned in 1934. I suspect the redesigned Basalt is the match.  
See Jaspert's \_Type Enclopaedia (1970) which shows the 1927 version of Basalt, with only the word "ENMITGLIED," which matches the Dan X. Solo "Harmony."
